issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: QA
components.description: Bugs/Tasks associated with the QA team

fields.description:
Seeing occasional failure to attach while using EMC in the multistorage tests. This is using some stale Netapp settings from a previous test, so likely a test issue. We don't see this when switching from the other backends, so opening the ticket in the case it's a real issue. Assigning to myself for now to either fix in QA and/or add more info in the case this is a driver issue. 
Thanks,
-M

fields.summary: EMC - iSCSI login failed due to authorization failure causing occasional volume attachment failures

comments.body: Have not seen this since moving the automated tests away from the multi-storage sequences. QA has been moving away from the 'multi-storage' sequences which swap out one back end for another and possibly do not clean up the previous state(s) correctly. This appears to be a QA env issue. Marking as resolved not reproducible.
